duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect patient health data by involving the patient, family, and other health care providers.
Perform initial assessment based on patient's presentation and records relevant data on the nursing component of the Interdisciplinary Admission Assessment.
Incorporate discharge planning into the admission process and analyze the assessment data in determining problem identification.

Communicate expected outcomes to the patient, family, and other health care providers to promote continuity of care and develop a plan of care that prescribes interventions to attain expected outcome.
Identify actual or potential knowledge deficits for the patient and/or family, and recognize hazards to patient safety.
Provide care that demonstrates ethical beliefs and respect for patient's rights and interacts with and contributes to the professional development of peers and other health care providers.
Participate in the evaluation of the quality and effectiveness of nursing practices and demonstrate the ability to maintain effective interactions with the staff on the unit and in other departments.

Maintain knowledge base through participation in learning situations such as departmental meetings, educational programs, professional association membership, journal review, or committee participation.
Comply with staff meeting attendance requirement.

education_certification.credential: Professional knowledge of nursing theory and practice acquired through completion of a two-year training at an accredited School of Nursing.
Current New York State license or Permit as a Registered Professional Nurse.
Interpersonal skills necessary to effectively interact with patients and their families that demonstrate recognition of cultural diversity.
Ability to clearly communicate in verbal and written format.
Analytical ability to assess and develop solutions to clinical situations or unit problems.
Maintains knowledge and proficiency in the clinical area and age group served.
